title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs. These programs provide full-time clinical nurse specialist education to registered nurses with the objective of producing qualified clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs. These programs aim to educate clinical nurse specialists who can provide care to patients with acute and chronic illnesses. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a primary care or wellness service managed by advanced practice nurses for underserved populations. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 851(b)(1)(A)(iv) of the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse specialists in addition to nurse anesthetists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs includes amending various sections of the Public Health Service Act to update years and programs, such as loan repayment, nurse faculty loan, and geriatric education. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and diverse population groups. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel, including individuals transitioning to higher nursing roles like registered nurses or advanced education nurses. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by developing and implementing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. Subsection (g) is revised to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
